become apparent to <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> senses. The story of
the Ascension <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> comes <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the range of
comprehensible occurrences, even if we make no
attempt to interpret it by more profound thinking
in another <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> altogether.
Perhaps to understand its origin properly we must
pay attention first to the ritual adopted in
ancient <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> in connection with initiation in
the Mysteries, ages before the Christian era. The
candidate lay down on a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> wooden cross
hollowed out so as to support the figure; was
bound on it (quite loosely so as to suggest the
voluntary character of the sacrifice) and then
was put (mesmerically) into a deep trance which
involved the emergence from the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of his real
<span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> in the astral form. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> was
then deposited in a sarcophagus, to typify

burial. In the astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> the real entity was
confronted with varied experiences educating him
in the idea that he - the real entity - was
beyond the reach of injury from fire, water, or
even the subtler perils of the under-world. Then,
on the <span class="t7 hoverable">third</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> was <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> up
into the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> of the sunrise, and its
"resurrection" - the return to it of the real Ego
- was accomplished.
Followed out more closely, the Egyptian ceremony
included other super-physical suggestions that
may have been in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> of those who sketched
the earliest draft of the Creed. Before being
awakened the candidate had touch, out of the
body, with sublime levels of consciousness, as
definitely an ascent into <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">heaven</span> as the underworld experiences were a descent into hell. The
under-world in question is, of course, only a
part, a low subdivision, of the enormous astral
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> that surrounds the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> globe, and is
growing familiar in these <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t6 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 hoverable">days</span> to many explorers.
Its loftier realms are widely expanded regions
that provide for happy conditions of life, and
for happy conditions as varied as there are
variations, amongst <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> still in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of
aspirations pointing to happiness.
How did it come to <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> that allusions to the
ritual of the Egyptian Mysteries found their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span>
into the Christian Creed? To frame a conjecture
we must begin by realizing that the Egyptian
ceremonial was itself an allegory based on
fundamental ideas connected with the science of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolution - fully understood by those who
invented the ritual. We can see this hinting at
the ordeal of suffering incidental to the
<span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> life, at the possibility of further
suffering in the under-world as the penalty of
evil-doing here, at the restful touch with
happier conditions (the ascent into heaven), at
the return to Earth-life after this - the
resurrection or more literally the reincarnation

of the Ego. Whoever infused into that early
"creed literature" the first suggestion for a
formula of belief must have had the Egyptian
allegory in his mind, <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t9 t11 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">together</span> with a perfect
comprehension of its deep meaning, as also
embodied in the Christian story.
For many reasons besides those that have to do
with the illumination of the Creeds, it is
deplorable that the clergy at large do not avail
themselves of growing <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> concerning the
unseen worlds, which might enable them in turn to
become more or less competent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> teachers.
Some few are emerging from the stagnant majority,
but for the rest to pose as experts in dealing
with the interests of humanity lying outside
those of the current life, while remaining
ignorant of all that is now becoming known
concerning the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> hereafter, is like claiming
to practice as a doctor <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> knowing more
about the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> than was known to the
barber-surgeons of the Middle Ages. Even the
humblest spiritualist has realized that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
hereafter is accessible to investigation. He may
investigate very clumsily. His grasp even of the
main idea may be very incomplete, but he knows
that he is in touch with another plane of
existence; that death, for all decent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> is
an introduction to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of a more promising kind
than that which the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane provides for
as a rule. The average clergyman, meanwhile, will
not avail himself of the means by which he - with
a more cultivated <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> - might not only realize
this much, but expand his comprehenson of the
ultimate <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> possibilities awaiting
humanity, to an enormous extent. If it were not
so profoundly distressing there <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be
something supremely ludicrous in the spectacle of
a vast organisation, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> raison d'être is the
general <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> thirst for guidance in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
thought, resolutely keeping aloof from avenues of
research provided by abundant experience to be
richly stored with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">wisdom</span> for all who

explore them.
This <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of the <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> will become more and more
impressive when attention is turned to those
passages in the Creeds which relate to the Virgin
Birth. For those who can only think in terms of
<span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane matter, the Virgin Birth seems to
strain imagination less than an ascent to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">heaven</span>
by a tangible flesh-and-blood Christ. Birth of
any sort is a mystery. A virgin birth <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be
only a little more mysterious than one of the
ordinary kind. But the first <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> that
suggests a pause for reflection arises from the
undeniable <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that other religions before
Christianity claim virgin births for their
founders. Is this merely due to a pious <span class="t3 t8 t9 t10 t11 t18 t19 t20 hoverable">desire</span> in
each <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> to dignify the origin of the founder,
or can it bear a more intricate explanation? This
is certainly the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> in reference to the
adaptation of the familiar doctrine to the
Christian story. To get at the actual <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span>
hinted at metaphorically by the virgin birth
idea, we must go rather deeply into modern
developments of super-physical science.
By its help we are enabled to recognize the
creative achievement, when a Solar system comes
into existence, as involving successive
processes: first the formation of molecular
<span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> from the atomic raw material pervading all
space. We need not talk about the origin of that,
any more than about the beginning of eternity.
But a Solar System has a beginning and a destiny.
It is an episode in eternity, and the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> of
a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> is an episode <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the enormously
protracted <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of a Solar System. Molecular
<span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> constituting in its various aspects the
chemical elements (as they <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> to be called)
becomes available for the formation of a globe
destined to be a living planet. We see the
process still going on in the growth of nebulæ
with which the heavens abound. At a later stage
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> pours out from itself the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>

principle. The vegetable and animal kingdoms come
into existence. Later, again, when the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span>
stage is reached, a further emanation from
divinity invests definite <span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">beings</span> with what is
sometimes <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> "the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> Spark," with that
which renders such <span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">beings</span> immortal, capable of
developing through successive Earth-lives the
loftier attributes of intellect and spirituality.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> stages are described by many phrases:
sometimes as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> waves of Atmic influence;
sometimes as the first, second, and <span class="t7 hoverable">third</span> Logos;
sometimes as the Father, Son, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Holy</span> Ghost.
Now when we attempt to see how this <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> affects the language of the Apostles'
and Nicene Creeds, we have to keep in touch with
another line of thought. The history of the
Creeds points to a definite <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> origin, but the
hints their language embodies point (as already
suggested) to inspiration from a lofty source of
wisdom; while it also betrays the corruption of
such hints as successive versions have been
prepared. Lofty <span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">wisdom</span> has always lain hidden in
the <span class="t13 t23 hoverable">hands</span> of the Elder Brethen of the race, who
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> knew that primitive conditions of
civilization <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> not allow of its general
diffusion.
The general diffusion, however, of large extracts
from it is now in progress, taking shape in the
<span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">Higher</span> Occultism of recent years. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> we can now
discern in much ancient writing of a religious
character the streak of inspiration and the
superposed blundering of unenlightened
transmitters of the inspiration. The <span class="t26 hoverable">passage</span> in
the Apostles' Creed about the Virgin Birth is a
thrilling example of both influences. The
adjective "virgin" has been applied in very
ancient literature to matter, as due to the
action of the First Logos, or the first creative
wave. Only when - after intervening development it is touched with the <span class="t7 hoverable">Third</span> Logos (or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Holy</span>
Ghost) can it engender the <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> principle. That

idea gets twisted, by primitive ignorance capable
only of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> along the lines of the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
senses, into the idea of a conception by a woman
<span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> of the conditions that generally give rise
to conception. And then in the Nicene Creed we
get the gross misunderstanding developed into the
unfortunate expression, "the only-begotten <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Son</span> of
God."
How does this subtle interpretation of the
familiar language fit in with the Gospel story
which the Creeds seem to follow? The literal
accuracy of that story has been challenged by
critics who <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> to miracles, and nothing that
can be <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> contemporary authentic history
affords it any sanction; but from the occult
point of <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> - that is to say, from the point of
<span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> that relies on something much
more trustworthy than <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> history - the story
is contemplated in a deeply reverential spirit,
but is not treated throughout as a mere record of
occurrences. The occultist has resources at his
disposal when investigating the past that leave
mere literary research panting in the rear. The
principle is intelligible to all who appreciate
the significance of clairvoyance, in some of its
suggestive developments. One kind enables the
clairvoyant to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">take</span> cognizance of events going on
at the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> in some distant place. Another kind
deals with events distant in past time. There is
a memory of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> in which some clairvoyants can
share, and that is faultless in its exactitude.
Cairvoyants who can do this while living the
ordinary <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> among us are few, but now that the
veil between ourselves and the Masters of Wisdom,
our Elder Brethen, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> Adepts, has been
lowered to an appreciable extent, many others
besides clairvoyants are in touch with Teachers
for whom perfect clairvoyance in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> is as much
a natural faculty as common <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> sight with
us. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> we need not be all dependent, when
desirous of knowing what really happened in
Palestine when Christianity was inaugurated, on

Alexandrian writers who endeavoured to frame the
record some centuries later. The memory of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span>
may discredit the literal accuracy of that record
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> impairing in the faintest degree the
reverential feeling with which we contemplate the
inauguration. The sublimity of the <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span>
incarnation is all the better understood when we
get rid of the idea that <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> when a baby was
already the Christ. No <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> being,
taking a new <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane birth for any <span class="t1 t3 t8 t25 hoverable">reason</span>
or definite purpose, ever takes charge of the new
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> from infancy. That is done by one of his
disciples. At maturity the disciple quits the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> and the <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> Ego occupies it. Most <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span>
at the present <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> are so densely ignorant of
their own constitution that they may regard the
idea as bewildering. At a certain level of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> is no more than a vesture to
be put on or off as occasion may require.
In the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> incarnation the Ego who
<span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> charge of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> in the first instance was
indeed of no ordinary type. And through later
births <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> (if we cling to the <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of the old
name) has ascended to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> altitudes in the
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> Hierarchy. But the Christ, who made <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> he surrendered in Palestine, descended
for that purpose from a loftier altitude still.
The bundle of miscellaneous statements at the end
of the Apostles' Creed, and also imbedded in the
Nicene Creed, need not claim much attention
except so far as "the resurrection of the body"
has been a stumbling-block for all who realize
the gross absurdity of the phrase in its plain
meaning, and may not understand that the astral
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> is that which resurges. But if we <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> on to
a consideration of the <span class="t7 hoverable">third</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> Creed with
which orthodox Christianity is entangled, we have
to deal with a blend of <span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">wisdom</span> and folly that is
very <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> worth the closest attention. In its
naked brutality the Athanasian Creed drives many
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> out of churches in which it is read aloud.

Some clergymen will not consent to read it at
all. Others, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> orthodoxy is equal to the
digestion of any horrors clothed in theological
tradition, are able to do so. Meanwhile those in
a position to reconstruct the teaching
ludicrously caricatured by the language of the
Athanasian Creed may easily divest it of its
blasphemous absurdities and show it to have been
originally inspired by profound <span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">wisdom</span> and
knowledge.
Summarized as it stands it consists of a series
of assertions that contradict one another,
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t9 t11 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">together</span> with a broad assurance that all who fail
to believe them both ways will be damned. "Perish
everlastingly" is the expression <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> at first,
but a reference later to "everlasting fire"
invests it with more specific meaning. To avoid
this fate we have to believe a string of
assertions frankly described as incomprehensible.
Strange to say, it is easy for any one who has
profited by the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> thrown in recent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> on
the course of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolution to discern, behind
the gibberish of the Athanasian Creed as it
stands, the profoundly scientific ideas that some
exalted teacher of the past must have tried to
suggest to some insufficiently receptive <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span>
engaged in the effort to express them. For there
is a period in the history of every <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span>
race (ours is only one of many) when the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> of
each person's "belief," or capacity to understand
deep <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> truth, has an important bearing on
his subsequent progress. The Solar System
includes other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> races besides our own.
Various planets represent humanities at various
stages of growth. Super-physical faculties even
far below those of "the Masters of Wisdom" (now
for the first <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> in this world's history giving
out such information freely) reveal the design of
the Solar system. Another planet was senior to
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> in its development, and its humanity is
already on a far <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> level of evolution than
our own. Both <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolution is not a process in

which superior <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> pushes the pieces
about, chessboard fashion, withour regard to
their own <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> will. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> in which this
sometimes seems to be done is at the bottom of a
hideous theological fancy, as grotesque as the
language of the Athanasian Creed, to the effect
that by <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> caprice some souls are "elect"
from the beginning, and sure of salvation from
hell-fire; others are surely destined from the
beginning to that fate. But what really happens
is this: some <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> their <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> will to accomplish
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> progress of infinite importance. Others
neglect their opportunities so persistently that
they are <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> behind; not doomed to any horrible
penalties, not annihiliated as entities, but <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span>
to carry on their evolution, if they are willing
to do so, in the next <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> planetary scheme
following on in due <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> after the one they have
failed to profit by to its fullest extent. Of
course, it is impossible that anyone can begin to
understand all this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> realizing the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of
reincarnation as clearly as we all realize the
circulation of the blood or any other fundamental
principle of Nature. But the appreciation of that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> corresponds to the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> reached by a child
learning to read, when he has mastered the
alphabet.
Now in the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> simply of the principle just
defined as guiding successive <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolutions in
the Solar System, we see in a flash the
underlying idea caricatured by the language of
the Athanasian Creed. Translate first the phrase
"Whosoever will be saved" from the blasphemous
<span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> - saved from hell-fire - to that clearly
intended by the original inspirer: "Whosoever
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be safe from failure to attain the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">highest</span>
possibilities of his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> in Nature," must
"believe" or, in equivalent language, train
himself to understand, certain <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> subtleties
of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> which frankly for the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
brain at an early stage of its development are
incomprehensible - i.e., beyond its grasp.

Physical, mental, and moral evolution proceed
concurrently. In a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> at a far more advanced
stage than our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> reached, the
majority of the Egos (Souls, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> entities,
<span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> them what you will) are engendering bodies
adapted to express Egos of similar advancement.
What is to be done, by the Powers that guide and
control incarnations, with the Egos that have
been so neglectful of their past opportunities
that they are not fit to animate the bodies of
the kind that are being born? The Powers in
question - and for the occultist they are
conscious <span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">Beings</span> on a very <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> level - can only
do one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t13 t15 t16 t20 t21 t22 t23 hoverable">thing</span> with them - <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> them on to the
scheme of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolution next in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> of
development. In other words, they have as a
consequence of their own neglect incurred the
inevitable necessity of beginning again. They are
not destined to perish everlastingly, but they
are thrown back in evolution for a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> period.
All Oriental writings - and our "sacred"
scriptures including the Creeds are saturated
with the methods of Oriental writers - are prone
to <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> like "eternity" and "everlasting" as
indicating any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> period they are talking
about, and not as we do - with a specific
mathematical idea behind them.
Vastly more than the difficulty of reconciling
the triple aspect of Divinity with the essential
unity <span class="t23 t28 hoverable">thereof</span> is hinted at by the inspirer of the
Athanasian Creed, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> clumsy interpreters have
been content to hammer at the one problem of
recognizing trinity in unity. But the elaboration
of the teaching the inspirer sought to convey
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> only have been possible for writers fully
illuminated with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> then "occult" in the
strictest <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> of the term. Early theologians
were certainly not among such illuminati, and
those responsible for the language of the Creed
before us were so ill able to discriminate
between credibility and absurdity, that they wove
into their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> the most loathsomely ridiculous

view of the Resurrection that any of the Creeds
suggest. <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> is described as sitting on the
right <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">hand</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Father</span> "at <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> coming all <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span>
shall rise again with their bodies, and shall
give <span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> of their own works," with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> or
damnation everlasting as the only varieties of
treatment available for their respective cases.
And <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> a little progress in super-physical
knowledge, available now for all who will profit
by current revelation, invests the idea of the
Resurrection with poetical charm. The astral
body, which rises again in every <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> when a
discarded <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> melts away into its
constituent elements, is susceptible of a
wonderfully beautiful change. Leave the evildoers out of <span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> for the moment - the very
bad cases have to be dealt with for a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> in an
appropriate fashion - as regards the vast
majority of decently behaved people, even <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> may have dragged on till <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> vehicle is
withered and destitute of all the graces of its
youth, the astral body, in which the Ego passes
away from it, soon undergoes a change the exact
reverse of growing old on the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane. The
old <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> or woman finds him or her self restored
in appearance to the aspect worn in whatever has
been the best period of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> concluded. All
who are in touch with the astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> - the
first super-physical aspect of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Earth</span> - will
be familiar with such changes; which, moreover,
in the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who have, in the course of
a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> life, far transcended the mental and
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> condition of what may have been
physically their best period, will somehow show
by new expression in that recovered best period
the mental and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> attributes imperfectly
developed during the Earth-life. It is sad to
think that multitudes of innocent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> are
allowed by ignorant teachers to grovel with the
foulest misconception of a beautiful natural
truth, when they ought to be instructed in the
exquisite charm of the arrangements made by
natural <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> - in other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> by <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t8 t13 t15 t17 t18 t21 t22 t23 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">love</span> - for

their happiness and welfare between successive
lives (as they ought to be) of strenuous effort
on the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane.
And that same idea spreads over the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> area of
conventional religious teaching. Creeds
incredible as they stand are matched by
theological doctrines that degrade the popular
understanding, even when refined away to some
extent by cultivated thinking, and represent the
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> capable of an anger so ignoble that
it can be appeased by innocent bloodshed. The
sublime Christian story in this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> gets itself
twisted into a shape in which it is offensive to
any lofty conception of the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> nature. Must
the authorities of the Church go on ad infinitum,
afraid to attempt a drastic revision of the
language employed in its services, for <span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span> lest
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> ecclesiastical structure should fall in
ruins as a consequence? If that <span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span> checks them,
the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> only shows how utterly they
misunderstand the drift of enlightened <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
teaching, available for all, now the veil has
been drawn aside from what was previously occult.
The wave of interest in that enlightenment is
sweeping all over the civilized world. And far
from making <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> hostile to the theory of an
established Church, it makes them think how
beautiful a condition of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be realized
if the Church <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> become a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
University, representing the latest developments
of super-physical knowledge, studying the varied
conditions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> during and beyond <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
incarnation, the possibilities of attainment
inherent in humanity and the stupendous programme
of the Cosmos to which our system belongs. In all
lines of study with which <span class="t14 t24 hoverable">intelligence</span> can
engage, if the mysteries of Nature, progress is
obviously the bright lure of the future,
stagnation an absurdity. And <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> stagnation in
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> is cherished as a principle by the
defenders of the cut-and-dried formulas of
medieval theology. Such defence can hardly be

designed to shield faith; its purpose can only be
to protect the institutions associated, to their
deep discredit, with the stagnant thought. It is
ridiculous almost beyond the reach of sarcasm
that professional religious teachers should be
the only kind who, parrot-like, repeat their
lessons unchanged from year to year - a senseless
articulation of sound - while out in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span>
discovery and illuminated <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> are widening
our intellectual horizons in every direction.
That clearing vision of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> which the
champions of stagnation cannot dim is really the
explanation of the strange <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> in which modern
civilization tolerates its clergy. All who profit
by the growth of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> feel that
this will assuredly, in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> run, permeate
the Church, and that, once emancipated from
medieval fetters, that organization may be
destined to a magnificent development. The trust
that this may be possible depends perhaps on a
far-sighted <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of the future; but when in its
moral progress civilization deprived orthodoxy of
its torture chambers and the stake, a change <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span>
in which may be slow, like the movement of a
glacier, but is as certain of effect, in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span>
run, as the glacier flow, and will ultimately
turn the frozen ice into a dancing river,
sparkling in the sunshine.

IMPRISONED IN THE FIVE SENSES
THE "Palace of Art" was replete with interest and
charm for its mistress up to a certain stage in
her <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> evolution; but a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> came when she
found herself - <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> still in its luxurious
magnificence Shut up as in a crumbling tomb, girt round
With blackness as a solid wall.

An emotion loftier than the thirst for pleasure
constrained her to break away from its
limitations, and to "purge her guilt" in a wider
atmosphere of sympathy with her kind.
Tennyson's poetry is so <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span> of <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> below the
surface that one is tempted to discern a deep
allegorical significance in the lines just quoted
over and above their obvious bearing on the plain
problems of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> - on selfishness and
sympathy. For all humanity at the present period
of its progress is shut in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the shining
walls of its gorgeous artistic and scientific
Palace, the contents sufficing amply for its
needs, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> as it is satisfied to ignore all
that lies beyond. The walls of the Palace are the
senses, inherent in the vehicles of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> on the
<span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane. As <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> as they are our only
avenues to <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> they are not windows
through which we gaze out into infinity, but dead
walls confining our survey of Nature's mysteries
to one aspect only of their manifold variety.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Human</span> <span class="t14 t24 hoverable">intelligence</span> of the usual type is, in
truth, imprisoned in the five senses, although in
the front already stand a few who have developed
new senses which reveal the <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> of worlds
beyond worlds in endless series, and, as turned
back on the past show modern civilization but
just emerging from conditions analogous to
childhood.

The character of the change achieved by those
illuminated by new senses may best be
comprehended by focussing imagination on the
condition of a <span class="t1 t8 t11 t16 t20 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">person</span> <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> the most
important of the five - the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> of sight. He
hears from others of natural phenomena he cannot
himself cognize. Descriptions will not help him
to realize colour or light. He will not
understand what is meant by "seeing" <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> he
cannot touch. Then grant him by a miracle the
gift of sight, and picture in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> the
complicated revelation that ensues. The sudden
endowment of an ordinary civilized <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> with
senses already possessed by some persons in the
vanguard of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> progress <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> mean a
revelation of even greater significance than that
suggested in the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> blind. The
liberation of <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> from previous
limitations <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be more thrilling in its effect
than any change that could <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">take</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span>
those limitations. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Human</span> <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> in its
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> is qualified to give scope to perceptions
all but infinite in their range. But with the
ordinary run of mankind any given volume of
<span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> incarnate in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> being can only
deal with the fruit of the familiar senses. Of
course <span class="t4 t7 t12 t16 hoverable">faith</span> and imagination seem to yield much
more, but are cramped by the familiar senses - as
shown by some ludicrous features of
anthropomorphic religion. For practical purposes
the senses are the channels through which we gain
knowledge. When we guess or speculate along other
channels, the mental conception of one generation
is apt to be thrown aside by the next, and the
history of Philosophy becomes an amusing cinema
film, that can hardly be <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> a kaleidoscope,
and there is not much beauty about it.
By far the most important discoveries which
reward the efforts of those who escape from the
imprisonment of the senses have to do with the
definite possibilities of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> progress

associated with enlightenment that may be
attained through new channels of perception. But
the laws and phenomena of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> are not really
divided by the hard-and-fast frontiers that
sense-perceptions seem to define. Grant anyone
amongst us certain new senses, and he will not
merely be enabled to perceive new regions of
<span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> with appropriate scenery and
decorations, brimming over with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of many
kinds, but will <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> the familiar features of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> around us all - those of the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane
- much more <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span> of <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> than they seemed to
be previously. I will illustrate this statement
by describing a scientific research carried on
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the last few <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> by means of superphysical senses, and happily involving something
like a self-contained proof of its conclusions.
It began under my own guidance, when working with
a friend brilliantly endowed with super-physical
senses. I had found that, quite independently of
results they gave us in reference to <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span>
conditions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> beyond the change <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
death, they were ultra-microscopic in their
character as applied to <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> nature. Could
they be so applied as to enable my friend to see
an ultimate molecule of <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> matter? The
magnitude of such molecules is so minute that
mathematical calculations with which, among
others, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> name <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Lord</span> Kelvin is associated,
lead to the conclusion that thirty trillion
molecules of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> are included in the volume of
a cubic centimetre. My friend undertook to try,
and I suggested a molecule of gold as the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> to
be examined. My friend emerged from the condition
in which he could attempt to do this, declaring
that, although the molecules of gold could be
individually discerned, they were far too
complicated to be described. They each of them
consisted of an intricate combination of smaller
atoms clearly belonging to a finer <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> of
matter. This observation led me to suggest that
perhaps molecules of <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> of less atomic weight

than gold <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be more manageable, and we next
dealt with a molecule of hydrogen gas. This was
found to be composed of atoms like those of the
gold molecule, but relatively few in number. They
could be counted. They were eighteen in number,
grouped in a definite design and in rapid
movement. The rapidity of their movement did not
interfere with the counting, for reasons I need
not stop now to explain.
We then <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">went</span> on to examine a molecule of oxygen.
This was found to be more complicated, but still
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the reach of careful counting. The <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span>
of minor atoms was 290 - a figure the
significance of which was at once seen to be
remarkable. Divided by 18 it gives us 16.1, a
close approximation to the recognized atomic
weight of oxygen. Atomic weights, on the usual
scale, are calculated on the principle of
reckoning the weight of an atom of hydrogen as
unity. The relative atomic weights of other
bodies are derived from calculations dependent on
their varied combinations, again in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> I need
not go into here, as that has to do with
commonplace chemistry. Was the ratio 18 to 290
operative in other cases? The atom of nitrogen
was examined and found to consist of 214 minor
atoms. That again gave the recognized atomic
weight when divided by 18. The result was
extremely suggestive, but did not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> constitute
proof that the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> run all through the
series of the so-called chemical elements.
Meanwhile the minor atoms claimed attention. They
were apparently the really ultimate <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of
<span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> - atoms of ether, themselves
below the limits of sense-perception. Only when
in combined masses - if the expression can be
<span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> in reference to masses so minute as the
atoms of the chemical elements - do they come
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> those limits. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> incidentally the
research I am describing <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> out a new
discovery. The etheric atoms do enter into
combination in numbers less than 18, but then

they do not constitute any known <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> bodies.
They are molecular varieties of ether, the atomic
ether being the kind that fills all space, the
molecular ethers being definitely aggregated
around the planets.
So far the research was carried out in the year
1895, and happily the results, including all that
I have described above, were published at the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> and are available for reference. Six <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span>
later Mme. Curie discovered radium, and its
entrance on the scene revolutionized chemical
science in more ways than one. Study of the
cathode ray had already introduced us all to the
"electron" as an entity, but radium introduced us
to the idea that <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> consisted of
electrons, and that transmutation was a
possibility in nature, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> vindicating the
alchemical theory of the Middle Ages which
nineteenth-century science had ridiculed. Inquiry
of the ordinary kind was now directed to the
questions, what is an electron? and how many
enter into the lightest known atom - that of
hydrogen? The clairvoyant research above
described had answered both of these questions in
advance, but was not <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> worthy of notice by
scientists of the orthodox type. The electron
came to be treated as an atom of electricity by
some scientific leaders, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> to others that
<span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> was unacceptable. Electricity is a force,
not a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of matter. To <span class="t9 t11 t20 t21 t22 t23 t27 hoverable">speak</span> of an atom of
electricity is like speaking of an atom of
gravitation, and that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be transparently
ridiculous. Occult research had shown from the
beginning that the electron, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> itself an
atom of ether, carried a definite unit charge of
elecricity. Orthodox opinions as to the <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of
electrons in an atom of hydrogen vary <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> very
wide limits. Some give us figures from 1 to 5;
some others guess by hundreds, and 700 is rather
a favourite estimate. The few of us who trusted
the clairvoyant research felt sure the real
<span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> was 18. Then in a few <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> came the proof

of this, a proof again so far ignored by science
at large, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> its ultimate recognition is
really a <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> of certainty.
The research of 1895 was only resumed several
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> later by my clairvoyant friend, assisted
then by another qualified observer. The task they
undertook was much more elaborate than the
former. Its purpose was to ascertain by actual
counting the <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of etheric atoms entering
into composition of a large <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of chemical
elements, also to depict the grouping of the
etheric atoms. The complexity of the grouping was
bewildering. Gold, for instance, consists of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> combined groups, an exact description of
which, unless illuminated by diagrams, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be
hardly intelligible. The important idea to
realize is that the counting could only be
effected by degrees, the etheric atoms in each
group reckoned up separately with the assistance
of a secretary who wrote down the figures as they
were <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> out, and only added them up after the
protracted observations were complete. The total
was 3,546. Then came the interesting question what figure <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> that yield divided by 18? The
answer is 197. The recognised atomic weight of
gold is 195.74. The deeply interesting principle
was vindicated and, as the protracted research
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">went</span> on, over fifty of the recognised chemical
elements were examined, and in all cases the same
principle was found to be operative. I have a
table before me as I write, showing the figures
reached in 57 observations of elements
commonplace and rare; and the result is nothing
less than a demonstration of the accuracy of the
original observation showing the atom of hydrogen
to consist of 18 etheric atoms. The notion that
the counting can in any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> have been made to fit
the theory is dissipated by the complication of
the work. Neither the observer nor the secretary
could have forseen how the figures given and
recorded by degrees <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> fit in with the theory
when added up. Eight of the observed elements

have over 3,000 atoms each; eight more have over
2,000. And an interesting hint supporting the
trustworthiness of the research is due to the
<span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that the observers found in the atmosphere
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> molecules that could not be identified with
any known element. Their electric atoms numbered
respectively 54 and 402, yielding the atomic
weights 3 and 22.33. Now in the course of Sir
J.J. Thomason's research (by ingenious electrical
methods) into the vagaries of the electron, he
found <span class="t1 t3 t8 t25 hoverable">reason</span> to believe and to announce that
there must be <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> unknown elements with atomic
weights of (about 3 and 22). He little realized
that the announcement vindicated a previous
announcement to the same effect giving similar
results attained by clairvoyant research.
But the 3 and 22 discovery was of insignificant
importance compared with the discovery of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> of atomic weights. No <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> done in
laboratories in connection with the electron or
radioactivity is of such far-reaching
significance as the atomic-weight discovery due
to the clairvoyant research. It shows us ether to
be ponderable matter, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> in its uncombined
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> it defies examination by methods appealing
to the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> senses. Optical methods tell us a
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> deal about the ether, but are silent in
regard to its mechanical attributes. Clairvoyant
research is the only kind that can expand our
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> across the threshold of the
region which lies beyond mere laboratory
research.
In describing the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> done so far by the
clairvoyant method as applied to certain problems
in chemistry, I have not stopped to give <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">chapter</span>
and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">verse</span> in reference to the dates of magazines
or pamphlets issued from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> and duly
recording results. In verifying what I have
<span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> I will gladly assist any serious
scientific enquirer capable of appreciating the
simple <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> that the research described is the

most important contribution to our comprehension
of <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> chemistry that has been made <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span>
any recent period.
And yet, striking as it is, it is among the least
important of the results attained by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span>
<span class="t14 t24 hoverable">intelligence</span> when once that breaks <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> from
imprisonment in the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> senses. The <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span>
shed on the gradual development of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> race
by clairvoyant research illuminates evolution,
and the magnitude of the design, to an extent
that renders the earliest Egyptian and Chaldean
records modern history by comparison. Besides
being ultra-microscopic, clairvoyance of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">highest</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> is retrospective almost to
infinity. There is no mystery in the <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> as
treated from one point of view. The duly
qualified clairvoyant can get into conscious
touch with the Memory of Nature, which is
infinite in its range. That is a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> mystery,
no doubt, only to be interpreted by very lofty
wisdom; but <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> reaching to such levels the
clairvoyant who has but just broken out of prison
can share in the universal memory to a certain
extent. One of the best books (Samuel Laing's
