granite rock <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> hardly make an appeal. We must
think of the astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> to begin with as
consisting of a vast series of concentric shells
entirely surrounding this Earth, the aggregate
diameter of which is enormously greater than that
of the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> globe. It is difficult to get
measurements in miles when dealing with the
region of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> in which, for some purposes,
distance is almost negligible, and yet, in truth,
there are definite magnitudes in connection with
the various subdivisions of the astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span>
which may actually be expressed in terms of our
measurement. Enough for the moment to realize
that the height above the earth's surface to
which the loftier subdivisions of the astral
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> extend is to be <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> of at least in tens
of thousands of miles. Then, if we begin to
attempt a survey of the varied subdivisions, we
have to recognize that the astral plane
interpenetrates the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> to
a fairly considerable extent, and that the
regions <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> submerged below the earth's surface
are horrible in their characteristics, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span>
definitely fulfilling a purpose in the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span>
plan of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolution. There are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> distinct
concentric shells of astral <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> sunk <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span>
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of the earth. The lowest of all is one
with which humanity has scarcely anything to do,
or ought not to have anything to do, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> in
the ghastly unprecedented conditions of Satanic

to the surface for our profound discomfort. Subplane No. 1 ought to be concerned merely with the
gradual disintegration of elemental forms that
played a part appropriately enough in the very
earliest history of this planet, but the need for
which has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> since expired. Level No. 2,

immediately below the earth's surface, is the
real Hell of actual Nature, a condition of
suffering for those who drift thither that can
hardly be exaggerated in imagination. That such
suffering, however, is destined to be curative in
its character is a fundamental idea to which, in
investigating that region, we should always
cling. It deals only with the most hideously
degraded and atrociously criminal representatives
of our humanity.

Roughly speaking, the fifth sub-plane is the
region in which intellectual activity can most
easily expand; the sixth is more devotional in

to any other with the velocity of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> is open
to any one belonging to that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> who knows, to
start with, that he has the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of getting
about in that way. In truth, that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> only
appertains to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who have ben making some
progress during <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> in occult study.
The vast majority of perfectly commonplace <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span>
on the comfortable lower levels of the fourth
sub-plane never want to investigate, for example,
the corresponding conditions of the Indian astral
world. In a still more emphatic extent the Indian
on the astral never thinks of its Western aspect,
unless he belongs to the few who have travelled
West in life.
Does the geographical idea adapted to astral
conditions embarrass <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> in any way? Are
there blank spaces corresponding to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
oceans? Not at all. The ocean spaces allow of
conveninent adjustments. Our British astral

stretches half across the Atlantic, and no doubt
impinges (though I do not remember to have <span class="t13 t14 t15 t18 t27 hoverable">heard</span>
of this as a fact) on the American astral,
necessarily a very wide domain.
For those who realize the importance, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as
the possibilities of getting definite and vivid
mental conceptions of super-physical Nature, this
geography of the astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> is extremely
significant. It all helps to make the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span>
complicated realm harmonious and restful for the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> multitudes. For all of us there may in
future be a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> when nationality becomes merged
in some <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> attribute of exalted
consciousness, but all progress is gradual. That
is the foremost principle to be discerned in
studying astral life. Spiritualists all recognize
it, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as those who derive super-physical
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> in other ways. For a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span>
passing on are on the other <span class="t6 hoverable">side</span> just what they
were here. Especially, therefore, they are of the
same nationality as here. If all the nations of
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> were jumbled up <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t9 t11 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">together</span> on the astral,
that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> not, as it does, show us the
laws and designs of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> in perfect harmony and
accord - in that symmetrical aspect which appeals
so powerfully to the intelligent observer. That
is the peculiar charm of the later Theosophical
teaching. It enables all who truly understand the
Theosophical movement to feel that they are
engaged not merely in stimulating <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
aspiration, but in the magnificent task of
creating a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> science.
4. - THE INFINITE FUTURE
As I have endeavoured to show, in dealing with
the phenomena of the astral plane, it is possible
to obtain clearly defined <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> in reference
to some aspects of the super-physical future
awaiting mankind. The immediately "next world"
may become so vividly forseen during our stay in

this one, that its importance to us may be
appreciated in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> rarely attained under the
influence of simple religious thought. That alone
may give rise to a beautifully reverential
emotion in reference to the future life, but not
to the same kind of absolute confidence
engendered by specific knowledge. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Take</span> an
imaginary <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> - in illustration of what I mean from the possible conditions of ordinary life.
Suppose a young <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> entering some business or
profession is told by some friend, "You might do
better if you <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">went</span> to America." The young <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span>
does not deny this, but still thinks he can do
fairly <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> at home, so he does not dwell in
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> on the friend's idea. Suppose he is
offered a definite engagement or opportunity in
America, and signs a contract to go there next
year. Will he not become at once deeply
interested in the conditions of residence in
America? He <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> read books about the country,
talk eagerly with travellers who had been there;
fit himself out with clothes and other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span>
appropriate to the climate he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> know to be
that of his future home. He <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> not neglect his
current work, because he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> know that his
efficiency therein <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> have much to do with his
welfare in the new life; but he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> look on the
current <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> with an eye to the future, attending
to it all the more zealously so far as it trained
his capacity, but with a <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> of detachment that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> make him relatively indifferent to its
immediate results.
Will the little parable fit the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of those who
are - and who are not? - destined to migrate at
no very distant future to the astral plane? Most
people, it is true, have made no attempt to get
information in advance in reference to the
conditions prevailing there, because they have
not believed any information on the subject to be
trustworthy. The misty suggestions of religious
doctrine <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> all details obscure. Spiritualism
incurred discredit in various ways, and the

importance of its main revelation was imperfectly
understood by the critical <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> at large; but
now we have to deal with a fuller revelation
conveyed to us by Theosophy. The history of the
movement since 1880 embodies its credentials. The
vision of the future is clearing up in many
directions. That department which includes <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
on the astral plane is illuminated by a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
wealth of knowledge. For all who appreciate this,
that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> sheds <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> on the path they are
actually treading through the current <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
life, and with an expanded <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of gazing into
futurity, we are already beginning to concern
ourselves with problems of infinite futurity
extending far beyond the range of astral
experience and <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> reincarnation.
The feeling with which we do this is very unlike
that which governs the investigation of astral
conditions. The ultimate conditions of our
humanity when the history of this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> is
complete are interesting only to thinkers who can
deal in imagination with states of consciousness,
so far transcending that of any personal life,
that they are content to lose touch with the
limitations which actually engender the feeling
of individuality. And if, as we may, we look
beyond the limitations of the one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> we seem
to lose sight of ourselves. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> the
contemplation of infinite futurity is not at the
first glance at all events compatible with an
interest in ourselves. But none the less does it
dignify all thinking, even of the kind which does
relate to ourselves. We know that the continuity
of our individual <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> will never be
broken. Plant us suddenly in the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> we shall
be in - say, ten million <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> hence - and that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be so unlike our present <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> that we
should not recognize ourselves. The leap <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be
equivalent to annihiliation of our present
selves. The gradual character of the change will
preclude this unhappy result. So we really may
discuss the problems of infinitude with composure

without making the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> mistake of projecting
our personal limitations into infinity.
Campbell's poem - beautiful in some respects "The Last Man" is a ludicrous illustration of
this mistake. "I saw the last of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> mould,
That shall Creation's <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">death</span> <span class="t0 t6 t7 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t17 t20 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">behold</span> as Adam saw
her prime." No doubt "The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Sun</span> himself must die,"
but that will not happen till the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Life</span> of the
Sun, including ours, is transferred to another
vehicle, and we know enough to forsee the change.
We know that our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Sun</span> is one of many constituting
a stupendous Cosmos, of which the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> star
Sirius is the centre. We can apply the rule, "as
below; so above," even to this <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> of things.
The planets of our solar system breed their
humanities, which attain perfection, and <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span>
into <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> Hierarchies. The aggregate
hierarchies of each solar system in the Sirian
Cosmos must have corresponding destinies on a
loftier level. With us, planet is linked with
planet in accordance with a comprehensive scheme
providing for the ultimate perfection of all.
Beyond doubt the solar systems of the Cosmos must
be linked <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t9 t11 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">together</span> in a somewhat similar way. And
already we have learned something about their
destinies, which shows these analagous to the
idea underlying the succession of manvantaras in
each planetary chain of our system. A <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">sun</span> which
is in manifestation on the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane has in
a former manvantara been a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">sun</span> on a superphysical plane, and will again, in some
mysterious upward arc of evolution, be on a
super-physical plane. I avoid saying on the
Astral or Manasic plane because these terms in
reference to the Cosmos must mean something very
unlike their <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> in this one solar system.
All through these mighty changes the continuity
of each individual <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> concerned with
them will be maintained. However overwhelming to
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> may be the character of these colossal
processes of change, we can already contemplate

them with open-eyed admiration, as on a lesser
scale we may contemplate the splendour of a
mountain range bathed in the colours of the
sunset. Even natural beauty and grandeur of that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> is uplifting in its effect on the emotions.
So with the mental influence of attempts to gaze
in <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> at the infinitudes of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
development. By comparison our Humanity seems so
small - if, indeed, we can think of it all as the
stupendous magnificence of the Cosmos is partly
revealed to us. In one sense, if we can forget
it, so much the better. <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Truth</span> lies in some
paradoxical phrases about sublime results
attained by the loss of what seems everything for
the moment, but paradoxes may be misleading as
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as suggestive. If only by our capacity to
admire, we are identified with the glories of the
infinitude - the realm to which, attached to it
by ties that can never be broken, we eternally
belong.

THE PYRAMIDS AND STONEHENGE
INDEPENDENTLY of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> concerning the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> growth of humanity, with which
theosophy is specially concerned, a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> deal of
information that could not be obtained in any
other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> may sometimes be acquired by
theosophical students in reference to the plain
external history of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> around us. Literary
research in such matters very soon reaches the
limit of its tether. In dealing with the remote
past it is paralyzed for want of <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> records,
and at the best can only supplement these by
interpreting a few inscriptions on stone. With
their aid we are enabled to reach back in the
direction of what Mr. Samuel Laing calls "Human
Origins" some 5,000 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> before the Christian
era. But evidences which are not less certain
than those of Egyptian hieroglyphics, show us
that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Man</span> existed on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> at past periods
which geology fails to estimate with exactitude,
but which certainly extend back millions of
years. In this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> we are confronted with a
problem which, in its broadest aspects, only
admits of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> alternative hypotheses. Either for
those millions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> mankind existed on the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> in a savage state, never rising above the
<span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of the barbarous stone implements we <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span>
associated with fossil remains, or he attained to
early civilizations at remote periods, the
regular historical traces of which have been
lost.
Comparing these <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> views, mere reasoning on the
basis of evidence that everyone is equally
qualified to appreciate will go far to support a
belief in prehistoric civilizations. In Egypt,
the testimony of the monuments and of papyrus
records, already translated, carries us back to a
period about 5,000 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> B.C. But at that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> we
<span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> ourselves just as much in presence of
Egyptian civilization as at that relatively
modern epoch of Egyptian grandeur, the Eighteenth

Dynasty. According to the admirable German
Egyptologist, Brugsch Bey, Menes, the first <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">king</span>
of the dynasty mentioned by Manetho, altered the
course of the Nile by constructing an enormous
dyke, in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to facilitate the foundation of
Memphis. He was a law-giver, moreover, and is
said to have greatly augmented the pomp and
extravagance of the monarchy, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> showing
himself at the same <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> not merely a civilized
ruler, but one who had already contracted some of
the vices of civilization, a sure indication that
he belonged to a declining rather than to a
rising era of his country's progress. But, in
truth, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> have got into the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> of thinking
of him as if he were a primeval personage, merely
because he begins Manetho's list of the kings in
so far as that list has ben preserved for us by
the accident of its quotation by some classical
writers. The original <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> of Manetho vanished
probably in the smoke of the Alexandrian library.
It is known through other writers that Manetho
spoke of Egyptian epochs <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> previous to that of
the thirty dynasties; and even if he had not done
so, the situation faintly portrayed as prevailing
in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of the Menes is enough to show that
it must have been the growth of a social progress
extending into the past for almost immeasurable
ages previously. Fifteen and not five milleniums
B.C. must be <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> into <span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> - according to
some of the modern Egyptologists now engaged in
translating the papyri - if we wish to frame a
picture in our own minds of the rise of Egyptian
civilization.
Turning now to another modern investigation, we
have to recognize that by degrees a mass of
testimony has accumulated on our <span class="t13 t23 hoverable">hands</span> in support
of the classical legend concerning the lost
continent of Atlantis. The Egyptian priests whom
he visited gave a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> deal of information on
that subject to Plato's ancestor Solon. For a
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> modern scholarship was inclined to
treat the story as a fable, one hardly knows why,

because the recognized course of change on the
earth's crust makes it certain that most of what
is now dry <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">land</span> was once ocean bed, and vice
versa. There is an a priori probablity,
therefore, that some such continent as the
"fabled" Atlantis must once have existed. And now
there are abundant evidences, derived from the
surveys of the Atlantic bed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the last few
years, to show that the site assigned to Atlantis
was probably that of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">land</span> masses during
some former configuration of the earth's surface.
Furthermore, comparative archæology brings out
identities between the pre-historic symbolism and
remains of Mexico and Central America on the one
hand, and those of <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> and Syria on the other.
These point to a common origin which Atlantis
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> exactly supply. A persevering explorer of
Mexico and Yucatan, Dr. Le Plongeon, has, to
quote a recent and very striking scrap of
evidence, succeeded in deciphering the character
in which ancient Mexican inscriptions are
written, and has even translated a very old
manuscript saved from the vandalism of Cortez and
his attendant monks. This turns out to include a
straightforward record of the final catastrophe
which swallowed up the last remnant of Atlantis
ten or twelve <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago.
The question of Atlantis is immensely important,
and I am, for the present, merely referring to
the chain of reasoning by which its actual
<span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> in former <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t6 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 hoverable">days</span> is supported. A thorough
examination of the merely exoteric evidence on
the subject <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be a large undertaking in
itself, and I have another task before me for the
moment. But all theosophical students, and even
cursory readers of theosophical books, will be
aware that the teaching concerning the origins of
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> race that have been given to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span>
in connection with the inauguration of the
theosophical movement, gear in with that belief
in the former <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> of the Atlantean
continent which, as I have shown, is making its

way even in the outside world, which has nothing
to do with theosophy. Humanity, according to all
theosophical authorities, is evolved through a
series of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> root races, of which the
Atlantean race was the predecessor of our own. I
do not put forward the statement as in itself
conclusive, because the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> character of
theosophic teaching - as far as its really
qualified exponents are concerned - is opposed to
the principle of ex cathedra assertion. The
regular method of instruction adopted by the
Masters of occult science is to show the student
how his own interior dormant faculties may be
awakened and <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> to bear on the discovery of
truth, <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span> it has to do with the planes of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> and <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> superior to our own, or
with periods of the world's history <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> anterior
to our own. Until the pupil is sufficiently
advanced to have the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of applying his own
direct perceptions to the questions he may wish
to investigate, he is almost discouraged from
taking the statements of others, more advanced
than himself, on trust. But, at the same time, we
must steer a middle course between the attitude
of mental servility and the attitude of narrowminded incredulity. For the reasonable theosophic
student which has found substantial ground for
relying on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> and bona fides of the
occult Masters, from who our current theosophic
teaching has been received, the statements they
make in reference to such matters as the
character and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> of the Atlantean
race will necessarily have very <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> weight.
Indeed, I may go a step forward in explaining why
some theosophic students at all events come to
look <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> facts concerning Atlantis, and the
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> that can be thrown by occult enquiry on the
remote history of Egypt, as coming <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the
range of something nearer to them than the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> of their <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> teachers.
An instrument of research is placed in the <span class="t13 t23 hoverable">hands</span>

of theosophic students sufficiently advanced to
make <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of it, which actually brings a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
deal of the ancient history of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span>
the reach of their direct perception. This is the
faculty of actually seeing, with an inner <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span>
adapted to the process, former states and
conditions of any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> or <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> with which the
seer or clairvoyant may be in contact. Many
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> are so ill-informed concerning
the most interesting developments of science in
progress around us, as to disbelieve in
clairvoyance from A to Z. To those of us who know
better, that is like disbelieving in the
differential calculus - an attitude of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span>
simply absurd in presence of recorded facts and
experience. Clairvoyants may be one per mil, one
in ten <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> if you like, of the population at
large, but they are sufficiently numerous to make
the reality of their capacities as certain as the
occasional capacity of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> to
understand the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> mathematics.
Clairvoyance has many varieties and
ramifications, but that with which I am concerned
for the moment has been <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> - rather clumsily,
perhaps, by modern writers dealing with it psychometry. In its simplest manifestation it is
not very uncommon. I have met many people,
besides those who have had a regular occult
training, who are able, by fingering a letter,
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> looking at it or reading it - or perhaps
by putting it to their foreheads - to get
impressions concerning the <span class="t1 t8 t11 t16 t20 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">person</span> who has <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span>
it, extending sometimes to an accurate
delienation of his outward appearance and
character. Now, this accomplishment depends <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span>
facts of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> that are enormously important in
their wider manifestations. Psychometrising
letters bears to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> under which it becomes
possible much the same relation that the
experiment of rubbing sealing-wax so as to make
it attract little bits of paper bears the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span>
science of electricity. There is a medium in

Nature in which pictures, so to speak, of all
that has ever <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> on <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> are
indestructively preserved for ever. This medium
is spoken of in the occult literature of the East
as the Akasa. European medieval occultists mean
the same <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t13 t15 t16 t20 t21 t22 t23 hoverable">thing</span> when they <span class="t9 t11 t20 t21 t22 t23 t27 hoverable">speak</span> of the astral
light. This astral <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> includes a record for
those who can perceive and interpret it, that
dwarfs to insignificance the value, for
historical purposes, of all the <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> documents
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> contains.
Psychic faculties of a very adept-like order,
educated, moreover, with scientific precision,
and borne up on a highly spiritualized character,
are required for the complete exploration of the
astral light. Such faculties belong to the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span>
theosophic teachers, and it is partly to their
exercise that is due the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> concerning the
remote past of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> which they possess. I
say "partly" because, in truth, the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span>
initiates of occultism possess <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> records
that have been handed down to them by a line of
predecessors, but their own faculties enable them
to verify these at any time. And, in truth, there
are stages of development which many of their
pupils reach from which a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> deal of
historical - not to <span class="t9 t11 t20 t21 t22 t23 t27 hoverable">speak</span> for the moment of other
sorts of - information can be gathered from the
astral light. This has sometimes been <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> the
Memory of Nature. All memory - even that of the
most familiar kind - is in <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> a reading in the
astral light. But the faculties that have not
been developed by occult training are only
capable of reading those records, at the making
of which the <span class="t1 t8 t11 t16 t20 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">person</span> concerned has actually been
present. Only with those have his astral senses
been closely enough associated to make it
possible for him to recover touch with them at
will. The occultist <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> astral senses are very
much more delicate is able to follow other
channels of association, other magnetic currents,
to <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> the technical expression, and this hint

gives us the clue to the comprehension of the
psychometric faculty.
Tangible objects, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as the inner vehicles
of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> consciousness, are connected by
permanent magnetic currents with the astral
records that have been originally established in
their neighbourhood. The trained occultist, by
touching or handling such tangible objects, is
enabled to get <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> these currents, to put his
own astral senses into the same relationship with
the astral records to which such currents lead,
as that which normally exists between his own
astral self and bygone scenes of his own <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
that he has witnessed. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Take</span> the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of
recollections any of us may entertain of some
distant <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> he may formerly have visited.
Desirous of remembering it, he turns back his
thoughts <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> that page of his memory, and in a
certain interior <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> may be said to see again the
scene of which he thinks. The occultist in the
same <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> lays his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">hand</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the stones of a
building - or it may be enough for him merely to
come near them - and he can follow the magnetic
thread of connection which leads back his
<span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> to the early events with which they
were associated.
This is the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> in which, for the occultist, the
pyramids of <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> may be made to tell their own
story very much more fully than it is possible to
trace this with the help of fragmentary
inscriptions or documents accidentally surviving
the destroying influence of time. The extent to
which the psychometric faculty is trustworthy in
the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> below the level of adeptship
is a question that can only be considered in
reference to each <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> in turn; but, at all
events, I have had the advantage of being
assisted - in such attempts as I have made to
penetrate rather more deeply than usual the
mystery of Egyptian antiquities - by psychometric
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of a very <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> order, and I have been

enabled to check the information I have <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span>
received through the fuller <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> possessed
by those from whom the teaching put forward in
various theosophic books from my <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">hand</span> has been
derived. In this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> I have been enabled to build
up a conception of the early beginnings of
Egyptian civilization which constitutes a
coherent and intelligible sketch of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span>
process, and synthesises in a very interesting
manner a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> deal of disjointed speculation
concerning the evolution of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> race
towards which archæological research of the
ordinary kind has been groping its way. I will
now put forward the story for the benefit of all
who may be sufficiently in touch with occult
methods of investigation to appreciate its prima
facie claim to attention.
Of course, the investigation of Egyptian
beginnings brings us into relations with the
Atlantean race. If we go back far enough in the
history of mankind - if we go back a million
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> - we <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> ourselves in the midst of a
period when there was next to nothing else in the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> of a population on the earth, except the
Atlantean race - inhabiting many regions, as the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> was then configurated, besides those which
formed part of the continent of Atlantis - just
as at the present day, to draw an illustration
from one of the minor ethnological divisions of
our own <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> race, the Caucasians inhabit many
other regions of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> besides the Caucasus.
But different ramifications of the same root race
may differ very widely from each other: and at a
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> when the main <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of the Atlantean race on
the continent of Atlantis had attained a very
<span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> degree of civilization and power, Egypt,
amongst other countries, was in the occupation of
a relatively primitive people, whom we need not
think of as savage or barbarous in the worst
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> of those words, but for whom the arts and
customs of civilization were as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> a closed
book.

As far back as 800,000 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago the Atlantean
continent, having all but fulfilled its destinies
in the education of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> race, began to melt
away. The process was inaugurated at the period
just mentioned by a geological catastrophe, on a
very stupendous scale; but that merely began, it
did not accomplish, what is known to occult
history as the submergence of Atlantis. The
continent held out against the destructive forces
of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> till about 80,000 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago, when some
considerable portions surviving till then finally
disappeared, leaving one big island - the
Atlantis of classical tradition - which perished
in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> natural convulsion about 11,500 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span>
ago, a date originally derived from occult
teaching, and approximately confirmed by Le
Plongeon's discoveries, to which reference has
already been made.
During the enormous period covered by the gradual
submergence of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">land</span> masses of the
original continent, extensive migrations to other
regions of the then existing <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> were
accomplished by detachments of the Atlantean
people. The most spiritually enlightened and
advanced representatives of the race were
especially involved in these migrations. The
destruction of Atlantis as a <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> process was
proceeding parri passu with the moral degradation
of the people. The adepts of the race shrank away
as much from the incurable degeneration of their
countrymen as from the doomed continent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span>
fate they foresaw. It was not in that decaying
and corrupt civilization that their influence
could any longer be exerted with advantage. They
had to discover a younger and more vigorous <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span>
stock, on which to graft the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> impulse on
which they were the custodians.
At that period a large part of Europe, especially
of eastern Europe, was an uninhabited swamp scarcely upheaved from the ocean to which

Atlantis was returning. But Egypt, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> very
different in its geography from the <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> of the
present day, was already inhabited land, as also
were the countries bounding the Mediterranean on
the east. Somewhere about the middle of the
enormous period assigned to the submergence of
Atlantis, a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> many of the Atlantean adepts,
accompanied by considerable numbers of their
uninitiated contemporaries, settled in these
countries, as also by degrees, and later on, in
the western regions of our present Europe, as
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as in many parts of the eastern world. On
ground which is now part of our own British
Islands, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> it had not at that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> separated
itself from the main continent, Atlantean adepts
<span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> traces of their presence, some of which
survive to the current epoch. In Stonehenge we
possess a memorial of the Atlantean dispersion,
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> that structure is of more recent date than
the pyramids of Egypt.
For a very <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> the adept immigrants who
settled in what is now <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> did not attempt the
education of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> in the arts of
civilization. They simply resided in the country,
and there, no doubt, <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> individual pupils,
and upheld the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> which,
however ill qualified to assimilate it the bulk
of mankind at any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> may be, can never be
allowed to die out altogether, even if its
guardians, as they sometimes may in the crises of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> evolution, diminish to a few in number.
What may have been the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> of the unseen
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> influence they were bringing to bear
all the while on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> amongst whom they
lived, is a question that I need not attempt to
deal with here. The race around them was
gradually ripened for the teachings of a lofty
civilization, and no doubt was largely augmented
and elevated ethnologically by the infusion of
the immigrant blood, for, as I have said, large
numbers of Atlantean people, besides those who
represented the adeptship of the period,

accompanied their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> leaders in their
migrations, and mingled their descendants with
the original inhabitants of their new home.
Thus, at last, a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> came when the seed sown
amongst them germinated effectually. The adepts
began to teach and rule as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as to reside in
Egypt. The vague traditions as to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> lines of
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> Kings, who preceded those dynasties
chronicled by Manetho, are no mere fables of an
infant humanity, as the narrow-minded ignorance
of materialistic critics in the nineteenth
century too often supposes them. The <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Divine</span> Kings
of <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> were the early adept rulers, and the
golden age of Egyptian greatness was that over
which they presided, in millenniums far back in a
past so remote that one almost hesitates to
handle the real figures, amongst <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of whom
only a few as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> can have become completely
emancipated from the mental fetters, as regards
the duration of the world's history, forged for
modern Europeans by the imbecile interpretation
put by the theology of the Middle Ages on
chronological statements of the Bible. In
following back the history of the earliest
monuments of Egyptian civilization, by the help
of those imperishable records still to be found,
as vivid as ever, in the Memory of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> by
those who know how to gain access to its
boundless picture-gallery, we do not have to add
at a venture a few extra millenniums to the
conventional dates of modern Egyptlogists, but to
measure their ages on the scale of Atlantean
history. It was at a midway period between the
first immigration of Atlantean adepts in Egypt,
and the stage of the world's progress we have now
reached, that the pyramids were really built, or,
in other words, a little more than <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> hundred
<span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago. Closely connected as they
were in their origin and purpose with occult
mysteries, it is impossible to obtain from
initiated informants in the present <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> any very
precise statement concerning the design which

they subserved in the beginning. I have gathered
a hint to the effect that, although no doubt from
the beginning <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> as and designed to be temples
or chambers of initiation - the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid,
for one, certainly containing other chambers
besides the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> that have been discovered - one
purpose of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid was the protection
of some tangible obects of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> importance
having to do with the occult mysteries. These
were buried in the rock, it is said, and the
pyramid was reared over them, its <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> and
magnitude being adopted to render it safe from
the hazards of earthquake, and even from the
consequences of submergence beneath the sea
during the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> secular undulations of the
earth's surface.
This brings me to one of the most remarkable
facts about the pyramids, among those which
modern research has never suspected. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">Within</span> the
enormous period of the <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> there has been
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> for more than one of those <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> changes in
the configuration of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> about by
what some geologists, at all events, recognize as
a necessity of its constitution. The alternative
elevations and depressions of continents and
ocean beds are due to a slow pulsation of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of the earth, that may be likened, as
regards the surface, to the undulations of a sea
that has settled down in a condition of almost
perfect calm, but is still gently heaving under
the influence of an all but imperceptible swell.
Probably there are cross currents in such
undulations that may occasionally intensify, and
occasionally minimize them; but, at any rate,
they cannot be excluded from any reasonable
scientific hypothesis concerning the progress of
geological growth, however far beyond the reach
of our very brief historic records their last
manifestations may be withdrawn.
Occult information on the subject brings some of
them into view, and since the erection of the

earliest pyramids one such undulation - connected
with that which had to do <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the final
submergence of the last bit of the old Atlantean
Continent - depressed the region which is now the
Lower Nile valley below the level of the sea
which spread over the northern part of Africa except for the <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> lands near the Mediterranean
coast. The west coast was also dry <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">land</span> at the
period in question, but the present desert of
Sahara was a sea, and that sea spread over the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> country now fertilized by the Lower Nile,
as the huge undulation depressed its level.
The country of the Upper Nile was not submerged,
and thither no doubt the population of Egypt, to
a large extent, withdrew, although the
submergence, I understand, was cataclysmic enough
in its character to involve some destruction of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> among those who clung longest to the menaced
region. At all events, I am told that there was a
considerable migration of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> to the east
and west, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as to the south, and for a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span>
- I do not know exactly for how long, but for a
short <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> compared with the general course of
the undulations of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> rock-sheet of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> - the pyramids and the country round
remained under water. Incidentally this will
suggest that the present course of the River Nile
was not that which it followed before the natural
convulsion in question. The course to-day
differs, I am told, as a <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> of fact, from
that which it followed in the age of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
pyramid's construction as <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> up as Thebes. The
temple of Karnac is an Egyptian monument of
enormous antiquity, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> not so old as the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid, and it never shared the
submergence of the pyramid; but as far as the
course of the river was concerned, that was
different from what it is now, even as <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> up as
Thebes, at the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of the erection of the temple
of Karnac.
The sea again receded from lower <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> after an

interval, the exact duration of which has not
been given to me, and the pyramids were again
<span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> dry. Rapidly as compared with the geological
changes in progress, it was doubtless repeopled,
and again <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> in charge by the adept kings. I
am inclined to regard the period which now came
on as the really golden age of Egyptian
civilization. The decline did not <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> in till
much later. But Fate held another shock in
reserve for the ancient State. When the last
island remnant of Atlantis was submerged with
cataclysmic violence about 11,500 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago, an
undulation of the oceans led to some enormous
inundations, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> again becoming the bed
of a sea as on the former occasion, the <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">land</span> of
<span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> was overwhelmed with an immense flood,
which again dispersed its people. I do not
understand that this was on such a scale as again
to submerge the pyramids, but, at any rate, the
population was drowned or driven out of the
surrounding country - for a time. When, in turn,
this flood passed away and population spread
again over the land, there began that downward
movement of spirituality and culture which, from
the occultist's point of view, is the final brief
period of the decadence of Egyptian civilization,
though, for the modern Egyptologist, it includes
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> range of Egyptian history, behind which
some inquirers begin to look out for the
evidences of primitive man.
Probably when the decadent period began, or was
somewhat advanced, the tangible objects, whatever
they were, which the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid was designed
to cover, were removed to some other country
chosen as the headquarters of the world's
adeptship. And though, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> as the ancient
<span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">wisdom</span> religion survived in <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> to any
considerable extent, the pyramids continued to
fulfil their purpose as temples of initiation, by
degrees, no doubt, the <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> concerning
their uses in this respect faded out from among
the people. On the face of things, it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> only

be initiated adepts that chambers dedicated to
secret ceremonies could be put to such uses, and
with the fading out of the adept element in the
population, due to its own moral deterioration,
the old traditions <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> naturally be lost. This
consideration will, amongst others, abundantly
<span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> for the multiplication of pyramids in
comparatively recent ages, when certainly, there
was no <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> on the part of the builders of
using them in connection with the introduction of
neophytes to the mysteries of occult science. As
late as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the last few <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> some
of the pyramids along the Nile valley have been
erected. While, therefore, occult teaching
entirely discountenances the conventional theory
