that the pyramids in all cases were put up to
serve as the tombs of monarchs, it opens the door
to conjectures along that road as regards some of
the latest among them. From an antiquity with
which the decadent dynasties had probably lost
touch, the example of the earlier pyramids as a
fashion in architecture had obviously been handed
down.
Certainly the coffer of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid was
neither a sarcophagus nor, as Piazzi Smyth
conjectures, a standard measure of capacity, but
a font in which certain baptismal ceremonies
connected with initiations were carried out. It
is possible, however, that in the later and
degenerate period of Egyptian history - to which
all the Manetho dynasties belong - some of the
kings, losing touch with the ideas associated
with the more ancient pyramids in the beginning,
may have followed the fashion of their
architecture <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> knowing why it was
originally designed, and may have put up pyramids
to be their tombs. I understand definitely that
this was the case, but the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> in no <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span>
militates against the explanations just given.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid has been assigned by most
Egyptologists to a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">king</span> of the fourth dynasty,

generally known as Cheops, or more correctly, to
students of hieroglyphics, as Khufu. That monarch
is supposed to have built it, and to have gone on
adding to its size as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> as he lived. As his
reign was a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> one, the enormous magnitude of
the building - standing on a base the size of
Lincoln's Inn Fields - is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> accounted for. My
own information is to the effect that Khufu
simply restored some portions of the pyramid that
has suffered injury, also, for reasons that I
have not <span class="t13 t14 t15 t18 t27 hoverable">heard</span> stated, closing up some of the
chambers that were previously accessible. It is
admitted by modern Egyptologists that the
evidence which points to Khufu as the builder of
the pyramid is meagre, although the original
guess has been quoted so often now that most
writers assume it to be somehow known as fact.
The manipulation of the enormous stones <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> in
this edifice, as also, indeed, the construction
of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> pyramid itself, can only be
explained by the application to these tasks of
some <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> concerning the forces of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span>
which was lost to mankind during the decadence of
Egyptian civilization and the barbarism of the
Middle Ages, and has not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> been recovered by
modern science. This branch of the subject,
however, may be conveniently reviewed in
connection with some other architectural bequests
from the ages in which the adepts dispersed from
Atlantis were still taking part in the external
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of Egypt, and, indeed, of some other
countries now forming part of the European
continent. In England itself we have
architectural remains connected with the
ascendancy here at one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of Atlantean adepts,
the interpretation of which has been as much
clouded by fantastic theories as by the <span class="t26 hoverable">passage</span>
of the ages that have gone by since their
erection.

Stonehenge is a riddle that has perplexed
speculation as profoundly in its <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> as the
pyramids themselves. Most archæologists have
assumed that it was erected by the Druids of
ancient Britain, who were already disappearing as
a priestly caste at the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of the Roman
invasion, although still carrying on secret and
sanguinary rites to which some Roman historians
have referred. This somewhat crude conjecture,
which offered no explanation of the methods by
which an uncivilized race of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> like those
inhabiting the Britain that Julius Cæsar
conquered, could have handled the enormous
monoliths of which Stonehenge consists, did not
satisfy Mr. James Fergusson, who has devoted so
much painstaking research to the subject of the
Rude Stone Monuments, dealt with in his
interesting volume bearing that title. Mr.
Fergusson had a passion for discerning a recent
origin in all the remains of antiquity, and,
taking advantage of the obscurity that hangs over
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> hundred <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> of English history,
following on the abandonment of these islands by
the Romans, he has developed an elaborate
hypothesis, according to which Stonehenge was
erected in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">King</span> Arthur, to celebrate
one of the twelve <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> battles in which that
hero is said to have overthrown the heathen. Mr.
Fergusson will have nothing to say to previous
arguments that had assigned a religious purpose
to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> relics on Salisbury Plain, and makes
them out to have been nothing more than stones
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> up to commemorate a victory. He could not by
any intentional efforts to that end have supplied
us with a more grotesque reductio ad absurdum of
that general <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> which regards the
civilization now around us as having grown up
from an immediately preceding condition of
primeval <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> infancy. One of the reasons for
which Mr. Fergusson rejects the Druidical theory
is derived from the impossibility of supposing
that such a mere race of savages as the Romans
found in Britain could have handled the stone

masses of which the ruin in question consists;
but he is content to <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> lightly over his
embarrassment in dealing with his own theory, on
the assumption that after the Roman occupation
the Britons <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> have picked up a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> deal of
engineering <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> from their conquerors. The
Romans themselves <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> have been no better able
than the Britons to manipulate the materials of
Stonehenge. The "imposts" or upper stones of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> trilithons are themselves about eleven tons
each in weight, and the uprights thirty tons
each. It is nonsense to talk of such masses as
being moved about and <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> up in their places with
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> exactitude by builders simply employing the
strength of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> muscles in the work. The
mechanical resources of the present <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be
heavily taxed to erect a <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">second</span> Stonehenge beside
the first. Nor is the absurdity of such a
hypothesis measured merely by the weight of the
monoliths on Salisbury Plain. By Mr. Fergusson's
own admissions we have to <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span> into our survey
of the past the remains of Stonehenge and
Avebury, and also the innumerable "dolmens" that
are found about these islands, and in larger
numbers in France, Spain, and Scandinavia. It is
no <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> to give an explanation that will fit in
with facts in one case, if it fails to square
with those of another. The dolmens have to be
accounted for as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as the Arthurian battle
memorials. And in the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of some among the
dolmens the weights to be dealt with throw those
of Stonehenge into the shade. Dolmens are simple
structures, in which one mass of rock - the
capstone - is hoisted up on <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> or more
supports; and one measured in Cornwall, in the
parish of Constantine, is computed to weigh 750
tons. Another in Pembrokeshire is a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> tabular
slab, big enough for five <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> on horseback to
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">take</span> shelter beneath it. What were the uses to
which these strange monuments were put? The
Arthurian hypothesis leaves the <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> as much in
the dark as the Druidical theory at which Mr.
Fergusson takes offence. And the notion that the

Britons might have become qualified to raise
capstones weighing 750 tons, merely because they
had picked up some engineering skill by watching
the Roman road-makers, is too childish to
consider seriously.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">People</span> who contend, with Mr. Fergusson, that the
rude stone monuments must have been put up in the
<span class="t7 hoverable">third</span> and fourth centuries, because we know they
have not been built since, while they could not
have been erected by primeval savages, are simply
- <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> setting out on the argument consciously
- making smooth the path that conducts us back,
in search of an explanation, to a civilization
anterior to our own, the traces of which have all
but evaporated from the records from which, till
lately, we have been constructing the history of
the ancient world. Atlantis is the only rational
clue to the comprehension of Stonehenge, just as
it affords the only satisfactory solution of
ancient Egypt.
The information on the subject to be gathered
from those to whom the Memory of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> is an
open book, shows us the dispersed adepts from
Atlantis as the founders in Western Europe of the
religious rites that Stonehenge was designed to
subserve. At a much later period than that which
witnessed the Atlantean migration to Egypt, some
representatives of the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> Atlantean occultism
established themselves in the country which, in
the subsequent changes of <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> geography, was
destined to become the British Isles. Their
influence established a civilization among the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> which did not prove of the strong and
enduring character attaching to that planted in
Egypt, but which, nevertheless, gave rise to
considerable cities, all traces of which have now
passed away. And Stonehenge was erected as a
temple, in which the exoteric worship they taught
to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> could be carried on. It was never
covered with any roof. Its rude structure was
purposely adopted by the exiles from Atlantis as

a mute protest against the corrupt luxury of the
perishing civilization they had <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> behind. In
Atlantis itself the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> family had touched the
nadir point of materiality. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> developments of
scientific <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> had been turned entirely to
the service of the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> life, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
aspiration was entirely stifled in the pursuit of
material welfare. Personal luxury, cultivated by
those who were strong enough to secure it for
themselves, was the goal to which all the
energies of the race were bent. Many secrets of
Nature, which the science of this fifth race has
not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> recovered, were degraded to the exclusive
service of <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> enjoyment by the dominant
classes - for an inferior, servile race also
inhabited the country - and the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> adepts
of the period turned with disgust from a
community which it was not in their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> to
redeem. They <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> themselves the task of
implanting amongst a simpler and relatively
barbarous population abroad, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> descendants
were destined, in progress of time, to melt into
the next <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> race, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> enthusiasm
that might, in their case, lead on to an ennobled
future. So the external ceremonies of the
religion they taught were carried on under
guidance with stern simplicity. They built their
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> temple, of unhewn rocks. They sought no
architectural effects that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> divert attention
from Nature. They invested their cathedral with
no other claims to admiration but those depending
on the massive grandeur of its proportions.
But how did they overcome the difficulty of
manipulating the huge masses of stone, the mere
superposition of which, one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the other, seems
to have demanded mechanical resources which we
can hardly associate in imagination with any
period but our own? For that matter, in Atlantis
itself it may be found, when fuller <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> is
ultimately cast <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> its history, that mechanical
resources of a very advanced <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> were available
for any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> that needed them; but the builders

of that age were not exclusively dependent on
appliances of the kind we now make <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of in
handling large masses of material. In the
maturity of Atlantean civilization some forces of
Nature, now only under the control of adepts in
occult science, were in general use. The adepts
of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> were under no obligation to keep the
secret of their <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> jealously guarded; and
among them was that power, so rarely exercised
now that its very <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> is scornfully derided
by the commonplace crowd - the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of modifying
the force we <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> gravity.
It is rarely of <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> in public utterances in the
present day, when current <span class="t14 t24 hoverable">intelligence</span> is engaged
in channels far removed from those of occult
attainment, to <span class="t9 t11 t20 t21 t22 t23 t27 hoverable">speak</span> of adept powers that are
wholly out of gear with modern experience of
natural possibilities. But in reference to the
peculiar <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> to which I have just referred, the
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> is that the modification of the force of
gravity, by methods <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> ingenuity may <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span>
into play, can only seem absurd to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who are
ignorant of certain suggestive facts already
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the experience of scientific investigation
and, at the same time, wilfully blind to the
evidence of mysterious occurrences notoriously
taking place, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> altogether unexplained so
far, in the realm of spiritualistic experience.
Theosophists are, of course, very far from
accepting the theories of spiritualism in regard
to the destinies of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">soul</span> after death;
but the external facts, familiar to the
investigators of spiritualism, are facts none the
less which must be fitted into their places in
any conceptions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> framed by intelligent
reasoning. The foolish crowd ignore these,
because impostors are constantly detected in
imitating by trickery the comparatively rare
phenomena which, under the auspices of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
mediumship, illustrate the occasional activity of
forces that <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> at defiance the very limited
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> of natural secrets generally diffused

amongst us at present. But the remark attributed
to Galileo, e pur si muove, is highly applicable
in this case. In face of all that has been
recorded by qualified spiritualistic
investigators - a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of testimony which is not
affected in the smallest degree by exposures of
sham spiritualism in other cases - it is
curiously illustrative of the capacities of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span>
stupidity, that people, fancying themselves
clear-headed and sagacious, should continue to
discredit the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that, at <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> séances,
heavy objects are sometimes "levitated," caused,
that is, to rise or even float about in the air
under the influence of invisible agencies,or
forces that have for the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> being counteracted,
as far as such objects are concerned, the usually
operative force <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> gravity.
But that which happens only now and then, no
<span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> how rarely, must be traceable, if only we
knew enough, to the operation of some <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> as
natural as that under which steam expands. Nor is
there anything in the essence of the <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> more
mysterious in the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that solid objects are
sometimes repelled from the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> - or levitated
- than in the other <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that more usually they
are attracted. No modern physicist has as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> any
glimmering conception as to why or how gravity
works. We are no better informed at this moment
than Newton as to why the apple falls. We can, to
a certain extent, measure the force which
controls it; we do not know what that force is.
So with magnetism. There we have an agency we can
observe in action both ways - as an attractive
and as a repulsive force. Stimulate an electromagnet in one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> and it will attract iron;
stimulate it in another <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> and it will repel
copper, so that a mass of that metal may be
visibly levitated and kept floating on nothing,
apparently, at some height above the apparatus
repelling it. Electricians observe and can
reproduce the fact; they do not understand it.
The levitation of tables and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">beings</span> at

spiritual séances can only be observed
occasionally and cannot be reproduced at will not by ordinary observers, at all events - but
the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> has to be faced by reasonable men, and
<span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> into relation with our general thinking.
It is stupid to attempt an escape from the
difficulty of not understanding it by declaring,
in spite of the evidence, that the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> is not a
fact.
When, therefore, theosophists learn from those
among them in a position to become acquainted
with the powers exercised by the adepts of occult
science, that such persons can in the present
day, as of old, modify the action of the force we
<span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> gravity, so as to levitate ordinarily heavy
objects like masses of stone, there ought not to
be any indignant revolt of the understanding
against such a statement. As <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> it is impossible
to offer the ordinary reader direct evidence to
that effect of a kind that is calculated to
compel his belief. But the general situation, as
I have shown, is such that any positive
declaration of disbelief in the allegation can
only be due to ignorance or stupidity. Therefore,
we who have what we hold to be trustworthy
information on the <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> may at least put it
forward, very careless of scoffing, which, in
<span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of collateral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> now available,
stands self-condemned as irrational. The adept
custodians of that knowledge, concerning the
mysteries of Nature, which is filtering into the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> at large by degrees as science advances,
can and always have been able to control the
attractions of <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> in such a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> as to alter
the effective weight of heavy bodies at will.
That is the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> explanation of the marvels of
megalithic architecture. Working under the
guidance and with the help of the adepts from
Atlantis, the builders of Stonehenge, and of the
ancient "dolmen" altars found the enormous masses
of stone they <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> enough to be handled
with facility. Clairvoyant observers of

Stonehenge have seen the process of its
construction going on. The pictures of its
progress are all indelibly imprinted on the
Memory of Nature: they are visible now, as
plainly as the actual transactions were visible
for those who were present. And the vision shows
us the enormous masses of the trilithons being
raised to their places with the help of
scaffoldings, no more substantial in their
character than <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> in the
erection of a brick cottage.
Of course, although I did not interrupt my
narrative of the origin of the pyramids to say
so, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> stones of which they are composed
were treated in the same <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> as the materials of
Stonehenge. The adepts who directed their
construction facilitated the process by the
partial levitation of the stones used. This is
the simple, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> in one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> no doubt deeply
mysterious, explanation of the old-world
monuments in which enormous masses of stone are
employed. At the temple of Baalbec, in Syria,
there are single stones built into the walls,
each of which is calculated to weigh about 1,500
tons. Preferring an explanation of such remains
which only seem reasonable because it makes no
appeal to forces and powers with which we are
unacquainted, archæologists have hitherto been
content to assume that, with an unlimited command
of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> labour, the builders of such temples as
that of Baalbec may have been able to get their
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> stones dragged along causeways on rollers,
and may somehow have hoisted them up into their
places with the help of inclined planes. Such
hypotheses make larger drafts <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> credulity
really than those involved in the occult
statement. They <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> us to believe that
which is physically impossible; but the
impossibility is acceptable because it is
disguised in commonplace phraseology. Stonehenge
and Baalbec really stand before us imperishable
proofs that, in the age of their construction,

whenever that may have been, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> was
witness of an engineering which did not
accomplish its triumphs by brute strength, but by
the application of a finer <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> than even
modern engineering has as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> recovered.
I have said that it was at a much later period
than that at which the Atlantean adepts, who
first <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> the perishing continent, <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> up their
residence in Egypt, that those who settled in
Western Europe <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> on foot the grand and simple
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> worship which Stonehenge in the first
instance was employed to subserve. It was at a
much later period even that that at which the
pyramids were erected. I do not know <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span>
there was any <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> residence by Atlantean adepts
in Western Europe prior to the introduction of
their teaching among the people. Probably there
was, but, at all events, it was near the final
culmination of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> Atlantean continent's
submergence, about 100,000 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago from the
present time, that the grey stones still standing
on Salisbury Plain were first established in
their places. Among the facts concerning them,
which supporters of Fergusson's grotesque theory
have to <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> over very lightly, is one which
relates to the geological character of the stones
used. The outer circle and the stones of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> trilithons are of a composition that
suggest their derivation from quarries in the
neighbourhood. But the inner circle and the altar
stone are of a totally different formation, of a
kind which cannot be identified with any rockbeds
in that part of England. Such stone is to be
found in Cornwall, in Wales, and in Ireland, but
nowhere nearer. So from one of these regions the
materials of the inner circle must certainly have
been brought. Reasoning of the kind that is never
shocked by an absurdity, but is only offended by
the suggestion that modern <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> does not
embrace all the capacities of Nature, is content
complacently to suppose that the Stonehenge
builders <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> the massive materials in

question across many hundred miles of primeval
forest-covered country, or, by sea - all for the
sake of a battle memorial on Salisbury Plain when abundant stone, just as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> and durable,
was to be had in the neighbourood. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> of
the Stonehenge materials <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be alone enough to
make the Arthurian theory ridiculous, even if it
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> bear consideration along other lines of
attack. For the purposes of a mystic temple,
however, everyone who has a glimmering of occult
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> will apprehend that there may have been
considerations connected with those subtle
attributes of different kinds of stone, which
occultists generally <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> their magnetism, that
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> prescribe the employment of more than one
kind.
The worship of the early Druids, to give that
name to the occult teachers who made Stonehenge
their headquarters, was grandiose and simple.
There were processions and chaunts and symbolical
ceremonies associated with astronomical events,
especially with the rising of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">sun</span> on
Midsummer Day, when <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> crowds of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span>
assembled to witness the sun's rays, at the
moment of his rising, shoot through an opening
opposite to the altar, and illuminate the sacred
stone. There were no unholy sacrifices offered on
the altar in those days, and the only external
ceremony of a sacrificial <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> that <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span>
had to do with a libation of milk that was poured
over the stone. In accordance with the elaborate
symbolism of early occult rites, a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> deal of
importance was attached to the serpent as an
emblem of multifarious significance, and as the
adept Druids could easily control these
creatures, an actual living serpent was made to
glide up into the altar stone at the sunrise
ceremony, and lap the milk. There is some truth,
but much more misconception, in prevailing
notions concerning what is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> the "Serpent
Worship" of olden times. The failure of modern
students of religion to discriminate between

worship and <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of symbols has to do with graver
misconceptions even than those which have
entangled the commonplace interpretations of
serpent worship.
The chief Druid of the Stonehenge ceremonies in
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t6 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 hoverable">days</span> of the pure worship in the beginning
<span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> to march in some of the processions with a
live serpent round his neck. Later on, when the
adept influence was no longer present - many
milleniums later - the degraded chiefs of the
Druid decadence <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> to keep up the old tradition
in so far as it lay in them to do so, but for
prudential reasons wore a dead serpent - a more
fitting emblem than they supposed of the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> of
<span class="t4 t7 t12 t16 hoverable">faith</span> they represented. Lower and lower its
practices became debased, until the once sacred
altar stone was deluged no longer with milk, but
with the blood of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> victims, and this was the
only sort of Druid worship of which, through
Roman historians, we have any <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> records.
How did it happen that so terrible a change came
on? The age apparently, as far as ancient Britain
was concerned, was not sufficiently advanced to
provide the earlier adepts with a continuous line
of successors. Eventually, it is to be presumed,
one by one, no doubt, the earlier adepts ceased
to incarnate among the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> they could not lead
on to the path of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> progress. In
<span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> the graft they planted <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> a firm hold of
the stock to which it was attached. In Britain it
did not, and thus, while <span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> remained to a
comparatively recent period a <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">land</span> of <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span>
civilization, and one of the principal centres of
fifth-race adeptship, Britain relapsed back into
barbarism. Up to only a few <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> before
the Roman conquest it remained still faintly
tinged with the remote traditions of its
vanishing civilization, then it sank to its
lowest condition of decay before the commencement
of its modern cycle of progress <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the
historic period.

This sweeping survey of a past that will be more
fully recalled, no doubt, in progress of time, as
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> learns to better appreciate the inner
faculties of man, slight and sketchy <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> it
may be, has only been rendered possible by much
patient gleaning on my part, opportunities being
made <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of as they arose. It is possible at a
later date that I may be able to fill up some
details, but I hope the imperfect suggestions of
this essay may meanwhile be accepted as
contributing in some measure to show how
imperatively necessary it is to <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span> the
Atlantean origin of all civilizations belonging
to our age into the scheme of our thinking, if we
are to hope for anything resembling a correct
interpretation of the ancient world.

THEOSOPHICAL TEACHINGS LIABLE TO BE
MISUNDERSTOOD
IN the beginning of our theosophical studies we
had to be content with very crude conceptions
concerning the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> ideas to which we were then
introduced. It was not possible for those who
were endeavouring to teach us to convey to us,
all at once, a comprehension of those <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span>
planes of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> some understanding of which is
absolutely necessary to a correct appreciation of
even some fundamental principles that we have to
deal with. Indeed, that embarrassment has, it
seems to me, impeded all attempts at metaphysical
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> that have antedated the theosophical
movement. Intensely keen intellectual activity
has been devoted to the effort to penetrate "the
Veil of Isis," to outstrip the range of <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
senses, to determine the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> of matter, and to
analyze process of thought. But it has all
amounted to very little as compared with the
flood of significant teaching that we have been
able to obtain during the theosophical period.
With the help of this, by degrees, it has come to
<span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> that, in spite of the enormous difficulty of
grappling in imagination with conditions of
<span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> outside those with which we are
familiar, we have gradually been able to surround
some of the earlier teaching with illumination
which invests it with fuller <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> than we
could attach to it at first. We have <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> come to
realize that some of our earlier conceptions,
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> not erroneous - indeed, no teaching that I
have had to do with, as given to us in the
beginning, need at this later date be withdrawn
as erroneous - were incomplete to that extent
that they have given rise to misunderstandings;
and the attempt to clear up some of those
misunderstandings is the task on which I am now
venturing to enter.
Foremost amongst theosophical teachings liable to

be misunderstood - for want of adequate
comprehension concerning conditions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
hereafter and on <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> planes - stands that
fundamental idea, Reincarnation, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span>
which from earliest beginnings of theosophical
study we have realized as an essential principle
of evolution. Not only among theosophists has the
idea been appreciated. It is even surprising,
considering how much there is in the idea to
excite repugnance on the part of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who do
not understand it properly, that it has made <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span>
to the extent that we have seen, gradually
conquering acceptance more widely than
theosophical teaching does this generally. It has
frequently been defended in pulpits as not
incompatible with ordinary religious teaching; it
has been accepted by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> quite outside the
range of theosophical influence, as the only
possible explanation of what seems terrible
injustice reigning in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> - the mysterious
inequalities of condition that we see around us,
the differences not merely of welfare, but of
moral and intellectual development, of
environment, and so forth, which render <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> so painfully variegated. But theoretical
acceptance of the idea has not always rendered it
welcome to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who want to realize precisely
how the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> will <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> when they come to be
reincarnated, who are troubled with anxieties in
that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> that render the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> conception
exceedingly repulsive. They persist in thinking
of themselves as plunged afresh into babyhood, as
coming back with the <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> they are now
invested with, to be again subject to the
appalling limitations of the infant conditon.
They think of themselves as fretting against the
limitations of the baby state, wearingly enduring
their slow progress towards maturity. We have to
get rid of all such ideas absolutely and entirely
before we understand what reincarnation means,
and the first difficulty in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> of getting
rid of them, has to do with the distinction
between the personality of any given <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> and the

Ego of which that personality is a temporary
expression.
As we approach an understanding of this
distinction a new difficulty is apt to spring up.
When told that the personality of any given <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
is going to be merged in the Ego - as we are
definitely assured will be the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> as a rule to the extent that the details of the last <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
will fade by degrees from memory, that seems to
imply something resembling the annihilation of
personal consciousness, the only kind which seems
real, as contemplated from the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane
point of view. The same comfortless <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span>
surrounds a mistaken conception that has
sometimes been put forward in regard to the
ultimate destinies of humanity at the conclusion
of the Manvantara, the alleged re-absorption in
that Divinity out of which in the beginning
humanity emerged. Of course, if personalities
even remotely resembling what they are now were
absorbed into Divinity, as a drop of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> is
absorbed in the ocean, that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be equivalent
to annihilation, and mergence in the Ego when the
personality is passing on from this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> to
another seems, again, a species of annihilation,
for most <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> unable to escape, in imagination,
from the conditions of the current personality.
Now what we have to remember, first of all, in
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to get rid of that misconception, is that
protracted and vivid conditions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> intervene
between the disappearance from this plane of any
given personality and the next presentation of
the Ego on the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane in accordance with
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of rebirth. A very <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> interval elapses
before the personality with which we are
associated in any given <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> has accomplished its
mergence in the Ego. I have dealt to some extent
with that subject on former occasions, but it
requires continued attention. Remember that,
first of all, we have a considerably protracted
experience, which may extend to enormous length

sometimes - of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> in which the personality is
maintained in <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span> completeness on the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span>
levels of the astral plane. In a large <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of
cases <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> personalities have been highly
evolved, and who represented <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> intellectual
development in this life, elect to remain on the
<span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> levels of the astral plane for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> after
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> when they might have passed on to
Manasic conditions, had they so chosen, because
under those conditions it is possible for them to
gather fresh <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> along the line of their
previous work, and prepare themselves in their
next incarnation for much more extended
activities of a similar order. In a minor degree
the same explanation applies to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of less
advanced evolution, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> we have to remember,
in trying to think out the conditions of future
life, that they vary to an almost illimitable
extent. It is difficult in attempting to
interpret any of these mysteries to make adequate
allowance for that. Whereas highly intellectual
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> will elect to remain for a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> on
the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> level, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of lesser advancement
also, assuming that their lives have not been
very bad indeed, will <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> remain on levels where
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> is exceedingly enjoyable, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> not
necessarily in such cases very conducive to
further progress. But in all cases there comes a
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> when, in fulfilment of the necessities of
further evolution, all the inhabitants of the
astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> must <span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> on to the Manasic
condition. We must not think of this <span class="t26 hoverable">passage</span> as
in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> of a <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">second</span> death. It is quite <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span>
from all the anxieties and distrust that, to
often, embitter the approach of <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
dissolution, and it is hardly necessary to stay
utterly <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> from the suffering so often
attending departure from this plane. During
astral <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> many of the attributes that
contributed to make up the personality have faded
away. Its <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> emotions, its <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t8 t13 t15 t17 t18 t21 t22 t23 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">love</span> energies, its
intellectual capacities remain unimpaired, but it
has already shed most of the minor attachments

arising from its earthly life. It is getting
ready for that union with the Ego which must not
be <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> of as accomplished at once on leaving
this plane of life. Whatever desires may have
been engendered for the continuance of personal
existence, those desires will operate to retain
vivid <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> of personality on appropriate
levels of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> for as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> as their force can
persist. But, as I say, the Ego, the real
permanent self, is a more permanent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t13 t15 t16 t20 t21 t22 t23 hoverable">thing</span> than
any one personality, and, however important any
given personality may be compared with those that
have preceded it in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> career of the Ego
through nature, its importance has to be
expressed in a new environment, to clear the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span>
for which the minor details of the last
incarnation have been allowed to fade away, or
evaporate. But the Ego and the personality must
not be <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> of as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> separate entities. The
personality is, at all events, a partial
expression of the Ego and, sooner or later, the
Earth-plane <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> is withdrawn into the
Ego, sometimes rapidly, sometimes after a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span>
interval, but eventually in all <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> that has to
be accomplished. And the blending means the
absorption into the Ego of all that was important
in the personality that has lately been spent.
There is another interesting <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> connected
with that idea. Sooner or later a personality may
become so important that it is perpetuated, so to
speak, and invests the Ego with its own
colouring, instead of assuming from the Ego the
colouring of former accumulated experiences.
That, of course, will only happen at the
threshold of a very exalted condition of
development, and it does not apply to the
majority of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> at the present stage of our
life.
I must now go back for a moment to the
misunderstanding about baby consciousness. It is
quite possible that some of you may have read

accounts of strange experiences that have
sometimes been known in the Eastern <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> - I am
thinking especially of some cases in Tibet where babies who have been recognized as
reincarnations of a former incarnation have
actually been able to prove their identity by
pointing out hiding places in which the former
personality had stowed away various objects, with
a <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> to its ultimate identification. And, in
some cases, the actual baby <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> has uttered
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> identifying itself with the former
incarnation. That need not be <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> of as
conflicting with what I just now said. Whenever
that has <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> - and I believe it has <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span>
place; I do not want to repudiate the stories it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> represent a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> adept achievement from
the background, so that it may be <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> aside
altogether as inapplicable to ordinary life. And
almost equally inapplicable to ordinary <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> are
the cases in which very young children, before
the age of seven, have been known to exhibit
extraordinary faculties. I think these have
generally had to do with the reincarnation of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> musicians. We are all familiar with the
precocity of Mozart, who is said to have begun
playing the piano at six <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> of age. In
reference to these one can only say again that
they are altogether abnormal. Merely guessing at
the previous conditions that might explain such
cases, I <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> suggest that they represent an
intense eagerness on the part of the Ego to
express, on the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span> plane, some of the
musical ideas gathered from experience on the
Manasic level. We have always been led to believe
that on the Manasic level music somehow pervades
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> region, appealing, of course, in very
varying degrees to different aptitudes, but
filling the <span class="t1 t7 t9 t12 t14 t19 t29 hoverable">consciousness</span> of the advanced
musician with musical ideas he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be eager to
reproduce. Probably in a similar way, when the
mathematical faculty has become the leading
mental characteristic of an Ego, that condition
may equally impel the Ego to seek an early

opportunity for its expression on the <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
plane, and may <span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> for the "calculating
boys" one has sometimes <span class="t13 t14 t15 t18 t27 hoverable">heard</span> of; <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> we have
in connection with such cases to explain, the
best we can, the usual <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that the abnormal
faculty disappears or weakens as the boy grows
up. Such facts <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span> us into relation with a
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> volume of Nature's mysteries, which show
how, at early stages of evolution, there seems to
be a closer connection with the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> plane
than when fuller intellectual development has
been reached. Babies, animals, and early savage
tribes will sometimes give evidence of possessing
glimmerings, at all events, of astral perception
which fade away at later stages of growth.
I come now to consider various possibilities
which have to do with the re-attachment of the
Ego to a bodily manifestation. In the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of
Egos sufficiently advanced along the path of that
progress to which <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> is so conducive, it
may be possible for the <span class="t1 t5 t11 t16 hoverable">higher</span> self, if I may <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span>
that expression, or the Ego - I am using the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span>
terms as almost synonymous - to exercise a
definite choice in regard to the new incarnation
on which it will enter. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">People</span> already at some
stage "on the path," especially if they are
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> to return rather sooner than the
ordinary <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> provide for, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> probably
have a considerable range of choice in regard to
the incarnation they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> accept. I have been
priviliged to obtain some information bearing
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> cases that have actually occurred, and a
curious discovery emerges. In all such cases of
which I have heard, where several opportunities
have lain before an Ego coming into incarnation some apparently very much less attractive than
others - it seems almost invariably the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> that
the Ego chooses the least desirable incarnation,
as its desirability <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be measured from our
point of view. Incarnations in humble <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
involving a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> deal of what, from our point of
view, we should consider hardship and undesirable

conditions have continually, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> my knowledge,
been chosen by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of sufficient advancement
to exercise a choice, in preference to those
representing more agreeable conditions of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> on
this plane. From the Ego point of <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> nothing is
of really any importance compared with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span>
growth and progress, and it may not infrequently
happen that the humbler incarnation is, first of
all, calculated to get rid of Karma that lies in
the background, while it also not infrequently
happens that the humbler incarnation is
distinctly more conducive to devotion to
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> and effort than those where
pleasures and distractions of all kinds keep
people's thoughts centred on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> that they
are actually leading. And again it may happen <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> I am now about to <span class="t9 t11 t20 t21 t22 t23 t27 hoverable">speak</span> of a <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> that is
probably unique - that some definite <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> that a
highly evolved Ego has undertaken can be better
carried out in a humble than in an exalted
station of life. Most students of philosophical
literature will be more or less familiar with the
writings of that wonderful German philosopher
Jacob Boehme. Now Jacob Boehme's writings show
him to have been on the threshold, at all events,
of <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> Adeptship, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> in that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> he was a
humble cobbler, just a subordinate worker at that
humble trade. Why did he choose such an
incarnation as that? - for it is certain that a
Being on his level must have chosen his
incarnation. The answer I understand to be that
at the period in which he lived it was not
desirable that the teachings he had to put
forward - real theosophic teachings, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> not
illustrated with the amplitude of detail we have
since been priviliged to obtain - should descend
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> from any altitude of authority.
Only a few were ripe for them. It was held to be
necessary that they should be suggested, so to
speak, from a humble level of mundane authorship.
I am not presuming to endorse or criticize that
idea. I merely <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> it as given to me in
explanation of the Jacob Boehme incarnation. "But

why," I asked, "such a very ignoble position as
that of a working cobbler?" The answer, I believe
derived from himself, was - "No position can be
ignoble in which you are fulfilling the purpose
of the Logos." That seems to me to have been an
extremely beautiful answer, radiant with <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span>
that can be applied to many of the phenomena of
life. True, there are not many working cobblers
who are Jacob Boehmes in disguise, and we must
not be hurried into conclusions to the effect
